chat_messages.text:
Add a onkeyup event too, I want that calculator to update as I type

Also add a section underneath the calculator called "Presets" which lets the user click a model to populate the cost per million fields with that model's prices - which should be shown on the page too

I've dumped in some screenshots of pricing pages you can use - ignore prompt caching prices

Built me an artifact with no react that is a pricing calculator for large language models

It has four numeric inputs , for number of input tokens, number of output tokens, cost per million input tokens in dollars and cost per million output tokens in dollars

The result is displayed twice: once as dollars and once as cents. These values update as the number fields changed, no need to hit submit

Make it look nice on mobile
Those fields should all start blank, while the prices should start at zero. Use the "change" event not the input event
Cents and dollars should both be shown wirh up to six decimal places
The presets should display the input/output costs per million next to the buttons

You should spell GPT-4o correctly (lower case o) - also add extra buttons for the "Gemini 1.5 Pro > 128,000 tokens" cases - and when you display prices of the presets they should show decimal points like this: $1.25 or $0.0375 or $15 or $0.25 or $2.50  - so no decimal points for a number like $15 and always at least two for a non-round-number
The Gemini 1.5 Flash and Gemini 1.5 Flash-8B models both have >128,000 prices too
Add a disclaimer at the bottom that says "Prices were correct as-of 16th October 2024, they may have changed"
On wider screens the presets area should sit to the right of the calcualtor
If it's showing "Total Cost: 0.085500 cents" it should show "Total Cost: 0.0855 cents" instead. And use * { box-sizing: border-box; }
